alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Quay County; Roosevelt County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT, SOUTHWESTERN SAN MIGUEL, NORTHERN DE BACA, SOUTHWESTERN QUAY AND GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 900 PM MDT... At 815 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles south of Anton Chico to near House. Movement was south at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa, Fort Sumner, House, Colonias, Puerto De Luna, Santa Rosa Lake State Park, Taiban, Tolar, Pastura and Sumner Lake State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 239 and 289. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 318 and 356. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; De Baca County; Guadalupe County; Quay County; Roosevelt County
